fr.sorbonne_u.components.reflection.interfaces

Interface IntercessionI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ComponentServiceI, OfferedI, java.rmi.Remote, RequiredI
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ReflectionI
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    IntercessionConnector, IntercessionInboundPort, IntercessionOutboundPort, ReflectionConnector, ReflectionInboundPort, ReflectionOutboundPort

    public interface IntercessionI
extends OfferedI, RequiredI
    The interface IntercessionI defines the intercession services offered by the Basic Component Model.

    Description

    The Basic Component Model reflection facility is still under construction. The interface IntercessionI mirrors to a large extent the interface ComponentI implemented by the abstract class AbstractComponent and exposes the methods that allow to modify the internal representation of the component.

    Created on : 2016-02-25

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  IntercessionI.AbstractRemoteComponentTask
      The class AbstractRemoteComponentTask allows to create tasks that can be passed as parameters in inter-components RMI calls, otherwise these tasks look like a ComponentTask.

                      java.lang.String otherPortURI,
                      java.lang.String ccname)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        connect the component port to another component's port using the specified type of connector.

        Contract

         pre    this.notInStateAmong(new ComponentStateI[]{ComponentState.TERMINATED})
 pre    portURI != null and otherPortURI != null and connector != null
 pre    this.isPortExisting(portURI)
 pre    !this.isPortConnected(portURI)
 post   this.isPortConnected(portURI)
        Parameters:
        portURI - URI of the component's port to be connected.
        otherPortURI - URI of the other port to be connected with.
        ccname - connector class name to be used in the connection.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - todo.

      • execute

        void execute()
      throws java.lang.Exception
        execute a task on the component after all components have been started; this method is automatically called by the component virtual machine after all components have been started and the component calls in turn its own inner components. Implementations of this method can keep the control as long as they wish (contrary to start) but they need to begin by a call to super if inner components also have an execute method to be called; it is the responsibility of programmers to make sure that this does not provoke deadlocks.

        Contract

         pre    this.isStarted()
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - todo.
